content: reusable swiffer pad #reusableswifferpad the reusable swiffer pad is made with a bobble stitch for added toughness and durability and the top straps are ribbed for easy attachment and removal happy crocheting watch the full video tutorial for this pattern on youtube https //youtu be/12fx7gk9u-s 1 materials - yarn worsted weight yarn number 4 yarn bernat handicrafter cotton yarn 100% cotton shown in photos approximate amount of yarn 110 yards / 100 meters - 5mm crochet hook - yarn/tapestry needle - scissors - optional 4mm crochet hook and stitch markers tape measure abbreviations chain chain st s stitch es slip_stitch slip_stitch blo back loop only single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet bobble bobble stitch stitches bobble the bobble stitch contains 4 half-worked dcs that are crocheted into a single st as described below 1 double_crochet 1 yarn over insert into st yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops you should have 2 loops on your hook 2 double_crochet 2 yarn over insert into same st yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops you should have 3 loops on your hook 3 double_crochet 3 yarn over insert into same st yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops you should have 4 loops on your hook 4 double_crochet 4 yarn over insert into same st yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull through 2 loops you should have 5 loops on your hook yarn over pull through all 5 loops on your hook gauge 11 sts x 10 alternating row row 1 single_crochet row 2 alternate single_crochet 1 bobble 1 = 8cm x 8 cm gauge swatch will be 5 bobbles x 5 bobbles 2 notes - this pattern is for the standard swiffer sweeper if you have an alternate size such as the swiffer sweeper xl i recommend using the above gauge to elongate your pad as needed - the turning chain never counts as a stitch - place the 1st stitch of each row in the same stitch as the turning chain pattern mop bottom see this section of the video tutorial here chain 32 using 5mm crochet hook row 1 starting in the 2nd chain from your hook single_crochet across the row chain 1 and turn 31 row 2 starting with single_crochet alternate single_crochet 1 bobble 1 across the row chain 1 and turn 31 row 3-14 repeat row 1-2 31 ● once you have completed row 14 take that same piece of yarn and single_crochet around the panel using a 4mm crochet hook if you do not have a 4mm crochet hook a 5mm hook will work fine as well ● slip_stitch and tie off see image 1 for final mop bottom image 1 3 top straps see this section of the video tutorial here chain 13 using 5mm crochet hook row 1 starting in the 2nd chain from your hook single_crochet across the row chain 1 and turn 12 row 2-16 single_crochet
